What did early Canadian pioneer eat?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Ethel Dickson
Address: 8112, Hunter Street
Birthplace: Wiltshire, England

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? Year: 1909
Where did you set up housekeeping? Answer: A northern homestead
Where had you been living before that? Scotland
For how many people did you prepare meals? 3
How far was it to your nearest store? 6 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Each day
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? All we required

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Robin Hood
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lb., 100 lb.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.50
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 60 miles
What year? 1909
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 65¢
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? Yes
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it?
Dickson, Mrs. Mabel
Box 112, Unity.
